intro: Gamolepis, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Gamolepis is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain areas.
